name: Birnam Wood Apartments

google_reviews.author: Unknown User
google_reviews.review: Hot water is not existant. Put in a maintenance request, they came a month later

google_reviews.author: Shilo (Mae)
google_reviews.review: Lots of things needed maintainence when we moved in. Balcony is lovely, stains on the carpet not so much... it's very old and some of the walls were dirty in our room. Lights flickers when you turn them on as well. It's not horrible but it's not amazing either.

google_reviews.author: Andy nguyen
google_reviews.review: Had mice come in my dorm in stack 3, however the schools exterminator quickly solved this problem. Other dorms seem to be more run down with old carpet and loose kitchen cabinets. Not to bad for first apartment style housing though.

google_reviews.author: Crystal Schmalz
google_reviews.review: This is campus housing for WWU. It is all 2bdrm apartments, that are set up to housing 4 students (2 per room). It works out to being about $350 a month & you don't need a meal plan!! It has a full dinningroom & kitchen with a gas stove, double sink with gatbage disposal. A large living room, storage closet & food pantry. There is free on-site laundry as well!

google_reviews.author: Elizabeth
google_reviews.review: These apartments are great when it comes to the price but currently there is limited parking due to construction. If you're looking for an affordable option as a student at Western Washington University I suggest it.

google_reviews.author: Shara Rhoads
google_reviews.review: For campus housing, they're okay. It takes several requests before maintenance addresses a problem. My daughter's heat was stuck on high; turning it down or even off did not help. Once they did attempt to fix it, now that temperatures outside are getting colder, the heat won't turn on.

google_reviews.author: Quentin Jensen
google_reviews.review: best dorm, cheaper and is an actual apartment. facilities aren't mind blowing, but functional and well maintained. lots of community events

google_reviews.author: Conrad Norris
google_reviews.review: Its cheaply built, but its got a bit a charm and is priced competitively with other places in Bellingham and its close to campus

google_reviews.author: Debra Haraldson
google_reviews.review: It's for college students.  They do however need to give our younger generation a break in costs for everything while they are students.

google_reviews.author: Austin Voecks
google_reviews.review: A nice, cost effective option if you want to stay close to campus

google_reviews.author: Jack Montgomery
google_reviews.review: Acceptable but dated living space. It's what you make it!

google_reviews.author: Kianna Keck
google_reviews.review: I never lived here so I wouldn't know.

google_reviews.author: M. W.
google_reviews.review: You get what you give: cheap, but that's about it

summary:
Disclaimer

This article is generated by ChatGPT and is a summary of user reviews of Birnam Wood Apartments. It is only intended to be a tool to help potential tenants find a property management company or rental property. The summary provided does not reflect the opinion of ChatGPT or its affiliates, and there is no inclusion of identifiable information from the reviews.

Good

Birnam Wood Apartments seem to offer some benefits particularly appealing to students, as per user reviews. One specific highlight is the value for money, with reviews indicating affordability as a strong point, especially for students attending Western Washington University looking for close-to-campus housing options. Tenants appreciate that the cost includes a living arrangement with roommates, which is a suitable setup for a student budget.

In addition to the cost-effective rent, the apartments offer amenities like free on-site laundry, which is a considerable convenience for residents. There are notes about lovely balconies and a large living room space that contribute to making the living experience pleasant for some tenants. These positive aspects seem to emphasize Birnam Wood Apartments' fit for students and those needing manageable living costs.

Great

Several users provided favorable ratings, mentioning that the apartments serve well as student housing, with the infrastructure described as decent for the price point. One user review specifically praised the community events held at the facility, suggesting an environment conducive to building a sense of community among residents, which can greatly enhance the living experience at a student-centric property.

Another user review complimented the functionality and maintenance of the facilities, despite the fact they were not described as 'mind-blowing.' This review suggests that while the apartments may not be luxurious, they are kept in a respectable state, with adequate attention from the property management to ensure that the living spaces are serviceable and accommodating for residents.

Bad

On the downside, user reviews pointed out several maintenance issues that caused inconvenience. Residents have experienced delays in the response to maintenance requests, with accounts of problems such as non-existent hot water and stuck heating that were reportedly not addressed in a timely manner. Delays in addressing such essential concerns indicate room for improvement in the property management's responsiveness and service.

Furthermore, there are notes from users about the apartments' dated features and the need for better upkeep. Examples include old carpets, dirty walls, and loose kitchen cabinets, which illustrate a need for renovations or at least a more rigorous maintenance schedule. These factors potentially detract from the overall quality of living experience for some residents at Birnam Wood Apartments.

Ugly

Some user reviews indicate quite serious pest control issues, with at least one mention of a mice problem within the premises. This can be particularly distressing and is not only a comfort issue but also a health concern for residents. Although the review noted that the issue was resolved quickly, the presence of pests is definitely on the more concerning side of the spectrum for potential tenants.

Another ugly truth revealed in the user reviews is the issue with limited parking due to ongoing construction, causing inconvenience for the residents who own vehicles. Parking difficulties add an additional layer of stress for tenants, possibly affecting their satisfaction and the practicality of living at Birnam Wood Apartments, especially for those with commuting needs.
